cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.ITP. 

The paper discusses entropic matroids, which have applications in coding theory and cryptography, suggesting that it could belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The paper also draws connections between entropic matroids and secret-sharing matroids, which are related to Discrete Mathematics (cs.DS) and Cryptography (cs.CR). The paper discusses linear matroids, which are related to Computational Complexity (cs.CC) and Information Theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper discusses applications of entropic matroids to coding theory and cryptography, which could place it in the sub-categories of Cryptography (cs.CR) and Information Theory and Probability (cs.ITP).
